You will also be working as a full-stack website application developer in our Product development department and closely with the marketing and design departments and times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the designing of the company's various software products. You will gain real hands-on working with many aspects of the product on the front-end and back-end.

We are looking for someone who is very positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives.

Job Description:

We are looking for a highly skilled computer programmer who is comfortable with both frontend and backend programming. You will own a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail. You will develop and design backend architecture and work alongside graphic designers for web design features.


Responsibilities:

  • Developing backend and frontend applications.
  • Designing and developing Database Models and APIs.
  • Architecture documentation and code reviews.

Skills:

  • Degree in Computer Science in progress.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills.
  • Proficiency with fundamental frontend languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as React.
  • Proficiency with server side languages such as Java, Nodejs.
  • Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Postgres and Cassandra.
  • Familiarity with developing real-time applications.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills.
  • Good problem solving skills.
  • Attention to detail.

Tech Stack: (stackshare link):

Nodejs, React, HTML5/CSS3, AWS

About us

Kyte is a technology platform that brings seamless delivery into the rental car experience. We are building the most compelling and customer-centric way to rent a car. With our value proposition of an easy car rental delivery experience with consistent & approachable support, we saw record growth throughout COVID19, and are now doubling down on gaining market share.

We recently raised more than $9M in venture funding from some of the best investors in the industry (amongst others, investors in Auto 1, Bird, Lime, DoorDash, Flexport, and Slack).

-

At Kyte, we love what we do and we believe our diverse team of ridiculously ambitious individuals is what makes our company great. Together, we are mobility enthusiasts that have an assortment of wide-ranging backgrounds from Stanford, Berkeley, MIT, TUM, Uber, BMW, McKinsey, and others.

We are headquartered in the sunny, San Francisco Marina district where we enjoy Bay views, good food, and a proper sound system for those late night working sessions. We have opened our second home strategically close to Oktoberfest in Munich, just 5 min from the Central Station in the beautiful district of Nymphenburg.

We offer competitive compensation, significant equity, and the ability to shape a big vision from early on. We are laser focused on bringing on talented individuals that are aligned with our value and mission, to create a magical rental car experience from end to end. You will have more than significant ownership and impact on our company trajectory, and shape how people get around the cities they live in. Don’t see a position that perfectly fits? Feel free to drop your resume in our open Talent Community post, we look forward to hearing from you!

How we work

  • Our Backend is written with Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
  • Our Frontend is written with Typescript using React and React Native
  • We have the mindset "you built it, you run it"
  • We ship code to production (AWS) several times per day using Gitlab CI/CD


Requirements

    • Strong fundamentals in software development and computer science through a formal degree or bootcamp.
    • Programming experience and familiarity, from side projects or classwork, primarily in Python, Java, Go, Javascript, or any other similar language
    • Hustling-, hardworking- & shipping-products attitude: Go above and beyond to get things done!
    • Ownership: You are a self-starter and are satisfied by owning large chunks of the product roadmap.
    • Ambition: You are ridiculously ambitious and want to get the most out of your life.

Nice to have

    • Very good allrounder experience (Backend services, RESTful APIs, API design, server-side flow)
    • For frontend: Typescript using React and React Native
    • For backend: Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
    • Experience working in an agile setup using continuous deployment and delivery
    • Machine Learning experience (Tensorflow, Torch, Keras, ....)
    • Javascript / react experience
    • AWS deployments & DevOps
    • Data security and encryption mechanisms

Benefits

    • The opportunity to be a part of the exciting early stages of a well-funded, Silicon Valley based startup that has massive growth and venture potential
    • You’ll be able to work, innovate, and grow with a ridiculously ambitious, committed and fun team in the Munich and San Francisco tech ecosystem
    • You’ll have the ability to have major impact on a product that is on its way to impact millions of users in a profound way
    • Kyte benefits include significant equity, transportation benefits, gym benefits, office visits across between US and Europe and much more.

Remote

Position Summary:

The Intern for End User Services role will be responsible for collecting information from the TCH employees (our user base), compiling technical specifications, and developing and implementing the User Migration plan for the newly implemented Microsoft 365 platform. This internship will include immersion within the Microsoft 365 platform which is used throughout the industry as a standard collaboration tool for corporations and many other diverse organizations.

  • Minimum of 2+ years college experience with concentration in Computer Science or Information Systems
  • Enrolled in an accredited university/college program to receive credit
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and able to work without supervision

Qualifications Desired:

  • College focus in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related discipline
  • Open to new thoughts and ideas
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas
  • Willingness to participate\volunteer in group settings

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in Microsoft training sessions to better understand the platform
  • Perform end user inquiry sessions and gather user requirements
  • Translate user requirements into technical specifications (pseudo-code) collaborating with TCH and Microsoft Senior Engineers prior to user migrations
  • Develop user data workflows and integrate into M365 platform
  • Conduct and track user acceptance sessions to ensure the solution meets expectations
  • Integrate change requests received from Users into the data request solutions
  • Track and manage business as usual tasks related to the M365 user migration plan

Additional Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Research and gather documentation with assistance from TCH & Microsoft support personnel
  • Attend company functions and networking events

  • Perform special projects and initiatives as assigned

Performance Standards:

Behavioral & Leadership Competencies:

  • Possesses and applies broad knowledge of concepts and principles while exhibiting technical expertise in core subject areas

  • Excellent team player and effectively engages external\internal partners across the enterprise portfolio
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a focus for continuous improvement
  • Adhere to the corporate Code of Conduct and exude a lead by example approach

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

This role will be fully remote and participation in video meetings may be required. Work is generally sedentary in nature, but may require standing and walking. The working environment is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment available.

Job Description

The NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) enriches the environment and protects public health for all New Yorkers by providing 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water, managing wastewater and stormwater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. DEP's water supply system is comprised of 19 reservoirs and 3 controlled lakes throughout the system’s 2,000 square mile watershed that extends 125 miles north and west of the City.

The New York City Department of Environmental Protection’s (DEP) Bureau of Business Information Technology (BIT) is responsible for providing quality business, technical and IT system support to our users. This commitment is realized through collaboration, strong relationships and a unified vision with our partners at DEP in order to provide quality technological solutions to our business needs. Providing these services allows us to ensure that DEP continues its tradition of delivering excellent service to the residents of New York City.

The Bureau of Business Information Technology (BIT) Application Development Unit is responsible for highly technical and supervisory activities in the design, implementation enhancement, maintenance, and analysis of software systems and the development of applications programming. The selected candidate will assisting with the updating of web and mobile applications. Also, the individual may be required to test and design system prototypes. The selected candidate should also have a working knowledge of one or more of the following: .NET, HTML, C#, SQL, MS Visio, and MS Dynamics. Additional responsibilities will include assisting with documentation for existing applications, creating reports, and special projects.

Minimum Qual Requirements

As of June of the Program year the prospective interne must be a student matriculated in a college or be a recent college graduate (winter/spring term of the Program year).
NOTE: Appointment to this title is only valid for the duration of the Program, June - August each year.

Preferred Skills

  • Student must currently be enrolled at a college/university at the undergraduate level majoring in computer science and have taken software development and SDLC.
  • Student must have at least a 2.5GPA (on a 4.0 scale)
  • Student must have at least a junior class standing

Selection Criteria: - Strong writing skills - Effective interpersonal skills - Research capabilities - Familiarity and/or experience with computers/software - Leadership skills - Self-motivation - Ability to work well with minimal supervision.

To Apply click the “Apply Now” button

DEP is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to the diversity of our organization and workforce. We appreciate your interest and thank all applicants who apply, but only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

What Is GigRoster™?

GigRoster™ is a fully developed, experienced entertainment agency and talent buying organization, now in the process of creating robust booking tools for customers, entertainment planners, member performing acts and our team of Talent Coordinators. We are developing a truly unique model in the entertainment business for finding and booking local musicians and variety performing acts for any kind of event or function. We’ve built a platform which is free to our thousands of performing artists, bands, DJs and entertainers all over the USA. GigRoster™ takes entertainment booking to the next level by providing our member performing acts a way to promote their own business in a targeted and robust way, with no upfront costs. GigRoster™ is the only company in the United states and Canada that features a full suite of online promotional and booking capabilities and also includes personal assistance, from a team of experienced Talent Coordinators. Real humans, who, like our performers, have Real Talent across every phase of the industry. The resources we have brought together create phenomenal growth potential as we continue to enhance our offerings and the interface for our customers who book their entertainment with GigRoster™ Real Talent and the thousands of performers who are promoting themselves in pursuit of booking paying events through our platform and system. We want to have the best online UX and UI in the industry. Our next step is in continuing to upgrade and enhance the sophistication and functionality of our interface to take full advantage of the available technologies that will provide us a competitive advantage. We will automate many functions that can better serve our customers while still involving our team of live talent coordinators as facilitators. We are looking for individuals to join our creative technology team who love the talent industry and want to be a part of GigRoster™, helping to grow the services across the USA and beyond, in the exciting world of music, entertainment and talent booking services.

GigRoster™ is looking for a full stack web developer to help design and develop web applications that match performers with customers looking for entertainment. This role requires strong knowledge of modern web technologies and common user experience (UX) patterns. You will work closely with software engineers, designers, UX specialists, and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities

  • Writing production-ready code with fluency in modern front-end and back-end frameworks.
  • Engineering responsive web applications and deploying in Docker containers to Amazon Cloud.
  • Writing RESTful APIs.
  • Design and architect applications leveraging AWS services.
  • Learning new emerging technologies and taking initiative to offer technical direction and creative solutions.

Duration and Location

The internships are full-time (20 hours per week or as arranged) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May or June 2021.

We are a geographically distributed team. The business operation is in Seattle and the engineers are in Boston, currently working remotely from home. Working hours may be flexible.

Basic Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or will receive a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a STEM related field such as Computer Science and Computer Engineering.
  • Full stack experience with at least one UI and one back-end stack. E.g. HTML5/CSS, Node.js, React, Angular, JavaScript, Ruby, Ruby On Rails, Java, C/C++.
  • Knowledge of fundamental Amazon Web Services: S3, EC2, Fargate, lambda, VPC, IAM, and DevOps services.
  • Understanding of Agile Scrum based Software Development.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Expertise with Node.js, React, Ruby on Rails.
  • Exposure to mobile app development (iOS and Android).
  • Understanding and exposure to database technologies (e.g., postgresql and DynamoDB).
  • Experience in API design and development (e.g., AWS API Gateway and Swagger).
  • Experience with test frameworks (e.g., mocha, chai).
  • Working knowledge of AWS DevOps & CICD services including CDK, CodeBuild, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, ECR, and ECS.
  • Working knowledge of web technologies and security practices, such as: cross origin resource sharing (CORS), cross site request forgery (CSRF) protection, page load optimization, code splitting, and progressive loading.
  • Superior communication skills with the ability to work directly with business partners.
  • Experience as a musician or entertainer, preferably with professional working experience with an understanding talent booking concepts.

GigRoster™ is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. GigRoster™ is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

A successful candidate will be responsible for building and implementing one or more of our major project initiatives. This will provide real world experience and exceptional examples in this industry or other software development positions going forward.

Company Description


FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 9,000 customers across 103 countries, including more than 50 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.


Job Description


This role will be remote for summer 2021 but candidates should be open to working in Denver if they are converted to a full time employee after graduation.

Do you love the challenge of figuring out solutions to intricate technology puzzles?
Do you like to help others solve their network and information security issues?
If you answered YES, then consider a career at FireEye Mandiant as a Consulting Intern!

We have the expertise and experience in information security. This is our focus.
You’re not just a number and you won’t get lost in the shuffle.
You will be working on challenging technical projects that make an impact. You’ll be visible.
You’ll be exposed to many different environments and technologies.
You’ll learn from our best incident responders and red teamers.

We investigate breaches that make headlines (and many more that don’t), as well as break into applications and systems to identify security gaps for our clients. We find evil and solve crime, and are seeking candidates who possess the ability to think like an attacker and stay one step ahead of the game.

Find your niche among the cool projects you’ll be involved with, such as:
Incident response
Host and network forensics
Network traffic analysis
Malware analysis and reverse engineering
Penetration testing
Network, web and mobile application security assessments
Source code reviews
And more…

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct host forensics, network forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations
  • Recognize and codify attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations
  • Perform network penetration, web and mobile application testing, source code reviews, threat analysis, wireless network assessments and social engineering assessment
  • Build internal scripts, tools and methodologies to enhance our capabilities
  • Develop comprehensive and accurate reports and presentations for both technical and executive audiences
  • Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans

Qualifications


Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing a degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology
  • Technical skills in at least two of the following areas:
    • Strong knowledge of Windows OS and networking protocols
    • Basic knowledge of tools used for forensic collection and analysis
    • Knowledge of application testing and network security concepts
  • A technical security-related internship or other professional experience
  • Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship

Additional Qualifications:

  • Strong technical acumen and ability to quickly assimilate new information
  • Ability to successfully interface with clients (internal and external) and manage expectations of others
  • Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner

Additional Information


At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Requests for accommodation due to disability can be sent directly to HR-Accommodations@FireEye.com.

(Colorado applicants only*)

Minimum Hourly Rate: $20. Final rate will be determined commensurately with cost of living, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations.

Benefits: Employer subsidized benefits include Medical Insurance. FireEye also provides Flexible Paid Sick Time and Paid Holidays.

Company Description

ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

Job Description

Why should YOU intern @ ServiceNow?

Here’s what our “Class of 2020” enjoyed about working at ServiceNow:

  • “Work within a scrum team, develop code within a corporate setting, use Git to manage source code, how to read through proprietary documentation to learn about our proprietary APIs and code base, work with the company politics to share my views on the design, implementation, and management of the ServiceNow platform”
  • “The positive vibes in my team, and the very detailed code reviews given by my mentor and colleagues, which helped me learned a lot”
  • “Challenging projects that taught them skills in software development and have a concrete impact on the company”
  • “I was really glad to have important work directed my way rather than a bunch of busywork and leftover tasks”
  • “Face-to-face exposure to senior execs and having candid conversations to learn about the company, helpful team, autonomy to learn and drive my own projects”
  • “I've formed relationship during the summer that I know I will maintain throughout life. Putting yourself out there and letting your ambition shine results in the most rewarding experiences”


What my team does:

The Talent Insights Team leverages data to help leaders and other stakeholders across ServiceNow make better decisions about people. We are passionate about making ServiceNow an incredible place to work for every employee and helping ServiceNow achieve its mission. We believe leveraging data will help us make better decisions about our talent.

We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our products, reports and data. We live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.



What you get to do in this role:

  • Use Python and/or SQL to automate manual data processes and/or projects
  • Use advanced data analysis techniques to analyze and interpret large, complex datasets
  • Build Tableau dashboards to present and visualize data insights to various stakeholders
  • Help build the infrastructure and automation to ensure talent data are used effectively across ServiceNow


In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

  • Expertise in Business Intelligence, Math/Statistics, Computer Science or related fields
  • Strong understanding of statistical methods and concepts
  • Experience in Tableau
  • Strong knowledge and experience in Python and SQL
  • Strong communication skills at all levels, both verbal and written
  • Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects at a time
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high concentration on attention to detail.
  • Strong proficiency in MS office products (Excel, Word, Visio, PowerPoint)
  • Project Management experience

Requirements:

  • Actively enrolled in an accredited university as a full-time student, pursuing a degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, Math/Statistics or related field
  • Must be returning for at least one final semester/quarter after the summer internship
  • Able to commit to a 12-week internship in summer 2021 (May-August -or- June-September)
  • Must be located in the US during the 12-week internship

POSITION:
Intern, ServiceNow

REPORTS TO:
VP, Enterprise Infrastructure Systems

LOCATION:
Remote

Position Summary:

ServiceNow is a software platform for IT Service Management. It is based on ITIL guidelines to provide processes and workflows for service requests and systems management. The Intern for Enterprise Infrastructure Systems role will be responsible for collecting information from the Infrastructure Team, compiling technical specifications, developing and implementing ServiceNow workflows for the newly implemented Technology Life Cycle Flexera module. This internship will include immersion within the ServiceNow platform which is used throughout the industry as a standard configuration management tool for ITIL based organizations.

Qualifications Required:

  • Minimum of 2+ years college experience with concentration in Computer Science or Information Systems
  • Enrolled in an accredited university/college program to receive credit
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and able to work without supervision

Qualifications Desired:

  • College focus in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related discipline
  • Open to new thoughts and ideas
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas
  • Willingness to participate\volunteer in group settings

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in ServiceNow training sessions to better understand the platform
  • Perform end user inquiry sessions and gather user requirements
  • Translate user requirements into technical specifications (psuedo-code) collaborating with ServiceNow Senior Engineers prior to development
  • Develop ServiceNow workflows and integrate into ServiceNow request module
  • Conduct and track user acceptance sessions to ensure the solution meets expectations
  • Integrate change requests received from UAT testing into the developed request solutions
  • Track and manage business as usual tasks related to the ServiceNow request fulfillment full life cycle for development

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Research and gather documentation with assistance from ServiceNow support personnel
  • Attend company functions and networking events
  • Shadow multiple office positions and train in a variety of tasks
  • Participate in the daily ServiceNow scrum standup calls and provide updates on assigned status
  • Perform special projects and initiatives as assigned

Performance Standards:

Behavioral & Leadership Competencies:

  • Possesses and applies broad knowledge of concepts and principles while exhibiting technical expertise in core subject areas
  • Works well independently with minimal instruction\guidance, confident to escalate issues appropriately
  • Excellent team player and effectively engages external\internal partners across the enterprise portfolio
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a focus for continuous improvement
  • Adhere to the corporate Code of Conduct and exude a lead by example approach

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

This role will be fully remote and participation in video meetings may be required. Work is generally sedentary in nature, but may require standing and walking. The working environment is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment available.

Cadent powers the evolution of TV brand advertising. We provide marketers, agencies, operators, and media owners with data-driven solutions for buying and selling TV advertising. By connecting brands with opportunities across national inventory sources—cable, broadcast, and digital media—our technology improves efficiencies and boosts the results of linear, addressable, and cross-screen campaigns.

As we continue to grow, we’re looking for an exceptional Data Analytics Intern to join our Advanced TV team for Summer 2021. Interns will have an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a remote environment by working directly with our teams, not for them.

Interns will also spend the summer working on a group project. The project will be presented to a panel of company executives at the end of the summer. Details of the project and final presentation will be laid out by supervisors at the beginning of the program.

Summer Interns will be responsible for fulfilling tasks set out by supervisors from the specific department they’re working in, including but not limited to:

  • Attending team meetings
  • Performing research

Perks

  • Competitive pay
  • College credit (if applicable)
  • Intern development activities
  • Lunch & learns within each field

Our ideal A-Players will be:

  • A rising senior pursuing a Computer Science, Math, Engineering or Business-related bachelor's degree at a college or university
  • Hands-on experience with Python, Microsoft Excel, SQL and JavaScript
  • Excellent verbal and written communicators
  • Self-motivated with a desire to learn from a rapidly growing company
  • Confident to take initiative and collaborate with teammates
  • Able to commit to a full-time (35-40 hours per week) work schedule between June 7, 2021 and August 13, 2021

So, if the leading edge of media technology is the place you want to be, please contact us today and let’s start the conversation!

ClearVision Optical

Internship

Opportunity

Come work for a values-based organization that takes pride in its culture and invests in its talent! A winner of Best Company to Work for in New York State for five years, ClearVision has proven to work and live by its unbeatable core values. Starting as a small, family business, ClearVision has recently celebrated 71 years experience as an optical designer and wholesaler. Now a global enterprise, ClearVision is serving optical professionals throughout the U.S. and in 40 countries. We offer an impressive selection of superior quality fashion optical brands, including BCBGMAXAZRIA, Steve Madden, Revo, Ellen Tracy, IZOD, and our own ClearVision house brands.

We are actively looking for students who have demonstrated leadership qualities, are socially conscious, and displayed commitment via internships or existing jobs. These qualities align with our fast-paced, innovative organization. ClearVision s intern program combines real-world experiences with mentorship, training, community service, and fun. Recent program activities have included: Speed Networking, Build Your Personal Brand training, an Escape the Room team building challenge, and a book club with the President. We have been highlighted by One Day, One Job for our outstanding program, tailored to provide students with continuous, hands-on learning opportunities.

To further explore our program, please visit our online video.

Internship Program Requirements:

  • Applicants must be enrolled in an Undergraduate or Graduate program and have a minimum GPA of 3.3
  • Positions will require a commitment of:
    • 20+ hours per week during the school semester
    • 30+ hours per week during the summer session
  • Must be responsible, organized, and goal-oriented
  • Proficient at using Microsoft Word and Excel
  • A proven ability to initiate and maintain strong personal relationships
  • Possess strong written and verbal communication skills

Data Science Intern:

ClearVision Optical is seeking a talented college student who is looking for a hands-on Data Science Internship. This is a great opportunity for a student majoring in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Management Information Systems. We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical individual with outstanding problem-solving skills. This individual will assist in pioneering the efforts of integrating this emerging field into the company participating in data analysis, visualizations and the creation of dashboard tools to further our business and technology needs. In addition, s/he will gain experience in Data architecture, manipulation and cleansing techniques with delimited files structures using JSON, Pandas, and Scikit- learn. Moreover, s/he will gain exposure to machine learning methods, frameworks and libraries (e.g., PyTorch, Deeplearning4j). S/He should be proficient in Python, NumPy, Pandas, SQL programming, probability/ statistics and linear algebra. An understanding of Jupyter Notebook and Experience with HTML/CSS JavaScript, and PHP is a plus. Leverage your academic skills in this up and coming area to support applied solutions and add valuable insight into decision making.

Overview:

Cyber Security is one of the fastest growing fields. If this is the field that you would like to enter after college, this internship would be a great opportunity for you learn what it's like in the Information Security world.


In this internship program, you’ll learn about vulnerability management, risk assessments, governance risk & compliance (GRC), PCI and other aspects of information security. You'll assist our team with scanning for security vulnerabilities and gain hands-on experience with the tools that we use to protect the ministry. If you have programming experience, you’ll help the team with automation needs.


Qualifications we’re looking for:

  • A current student in their third or fourth year of college. Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science or equivalent.
  • A student who has taken general classes in ethical hacking, cyber security, information security, networking, or programming (C# or Python a plus!).
  • Able to listen effectively, respectful of others’ perspectives and contributions, and be able to both offer and accept feedback openly.
  • Passionate for learning and have a desire to help others.
  • Able to maintain confidentiality and a calm demeanor under pressure.


What can you expect from us?

During this internship, you will experience EMF life; working in a collaborative, innovative & technical environment with a team that is committed to serving Christ in all that we do. The work that you will do will be meaningful and contribute to furthering the ministry. Our host department will coach, mentor and challenge you. You will learn about your selected field, but more importantly, you will learn about yourself.


Throughout the course of this internship, you’ll learn from our team of leaders, gaining knowledge of the media industry and business acumen to better prepare you for the business world which lies ahead of you.

As a thredUP summer intern, you will be given a firsthand glimpse at what it’s like to work at the world’s largest fashion resale platform. During the 11 week program, you will tackle projects alongside our world-class team, with the opportunity to make a real impact on thredUP’s business. Our paid internships are ideal for ambitious students or recent grads who thrive in ambiguity, like a good challenge, and want a jump start on their career development. Oh, and who want to help inspire a new generation of consumers to think secondhand first.

About the Data Engineer Internship
As an intern on our Data Engineering team, you will work alongside thredUP's data warehouse team to build data driven products that will be used internally across several teams. You will get an opportunity to work on varied data sets and projects in our production environment that have a direct impact on the business. Your time will focus on one main project, with several side projects to insure the growth of several areas of skill.

About You:

    • 3 years of experience in SQL and Python development
    • Currently enrolled in a Master's Program in Computer Science or MIS
    • Relevant coursework in Big Data Technologies and Business Analytics
    • Strong Data Analysis skills and an eagerness to learn in a business setting
    • Bonus: hands-on experience building data processing pipelines in Apache Spark
What We Offer
At thredUP, we value infinite learning. As an intern you’ll have the opportunity to learn about our forward-thinking business and collaborate with our talented team.

We also believe that each person should help drive the business. As an intern, you’ll be encouraged to speakUP, think big, ask questions and seek the truth, and help influence outcomes for our business and customers.

You’ll have the opportunity to work with passionate and supportive team members who encourage new ideas, feedback and collaboration.

We have a talented leadership team that encourages transparency and they will support you in maximizing your internship experience.

Position Description


POSITION POSTED: APRIL 8, 2021
SALARY RANGE: $24,600 - $35,400 (SI II)

You ‘matter’ to us! Our diverse team at Jefferson Lab includes more than 700 people, including physicists, engineers, computer professionals, technicians and more. From probing the basic building blocks of matter to performing advanced computing and applied research, we are on the leading edge of science and technology. If you are looking for a great job in a unique place where your contributions truly matter, consider Jefferson Lab!

We're looking for a Cybersecurity Student Intern..

The internship position is for one year. The Computer Center Technical Student Intern works with the Cybersecurity Group within the CNI Department to assist with operation of the laboratory’s cybersecurity program. This includes monitoring, investigations, application evaluations, documentation, vulnerability scanning/remidiation, audits, and other duties as assigned. The Student Intern will also work with other groups within the CNI Department and the CCS&T Division providing operational cybersecurity support.

Position Requirements


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:

The ideal candidate will possess a working knowledge of the various Microsoft Windows OS versions, any Linux variant, Mac OS X and TCP/IP networking. This candidate must adhere to written and verbal instructions, understand and follow established lab policies, and have excellent communication skills both in writing and in speech. Home broadband network required.

The ability to program using C, JAVA, or other language along with the expertise to write moderately complex scripts using Python, Powershell, BASH, or others is extremely important.

In addition, the candidate must be enrolled full time in a local university, available to work 20 hours each week during school sessions (18 hours being the minimum), and 40 hours per week between school sessions.

Education and Experience:

Applicant must be a full-time college student with a GPA of 2.5 or better and must be majoring in Computer Science or a program with a concentration in Information Technology. Proof of full-time status and copies of transcripts are required (unofficial copies are acceptable).
Must provide transcript for consideration

Must be a US citizen.

Mental Requirements

• Ability to comprehend and follow instructions
  • Ability to understand, remember, and communicate information and make decisions
  • Ability to concentrate on details and detect errors
  • Ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks
  • Capable of analytic reasoning

Physical Requirements


  • Must be able to sit and work at a computer workstation for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to pick, pinch, or otherwise work with fingers; seize, grasp, hold, turn, or otherwise with hands.
  • Must be able to lift 35 pound objects.
  • Must be able to walk within facility areas, with occasional kneeling, stooping, crouching, and crawling.
  • Must be able to work in both hot and cold conditions.
  • Must be able to identify and distinguish colors, perceive temperatures, and smell.
  • Must be able to distinguish equipment noises, tones, and alarms from background noises.

Innovation Engineer Intern(Job Number: 336586)

Description


About Chubb

We are the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer with operations in 54 countries, exceptional financial strength, and a broad range of personal and commercial insurance products. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. We combine precision of craftsmanship with decades of experience to conceive our craft and deliver the very best insurance coverage and service to individuals and families, and businesses of all sizes.

Chubb’s insurance businesses in North America serve clients ranging from the largest multinationals, mid-size companies, and small businesses to high-net-worth individuals, middle-income consumers and farmers and ranchers.

Who We Are

We are a unique global organization with a culture of individuals passionately committed to our respective crafts. With underwriting at our core, each of us contributes to providing the best insurance coverage and service to our clients. Working together, we are one Chubb. Our highly collaborative, inclusive nature helps us drive better business outcomes through diversity of background, experiences, insights and values. We approach problems with a can-do attitude and are committed to developing deep relationships — all while moving quickly to meet client needs.

Internships with Chubb

Our summer internship program offers the chance to have practical, real-world experience at one of the world’s leading P&C insurance companies. As a part of the program, you will have the opportunity to work on business-specific projects where you will gain knowledge and experience to supplement and strengthen your academic skills. For those who excel in the program, we would welcome the opportunity to discuss full-time employment opportunities at Chubb after graduation.

The summer internship will run from June through August. It will provide awareness of the systems, projects, and technologies in a corporate innovation organization.

As part of our internship program, you will receive:

  • Opportunity to work in a fast-paced innovation organization that leverages a suite of digital technologies (such as AI, IoT, Blockchain, Cloud) responsible for fundamentally changing the insurance industry.
  • Technical training to deepen your skill level within your chosen discipline, and an understanding of our broader industry.
  • Access to additional training to complement your professional development.

Desired Qualifications

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Mathematics, or related field with a GPA of 3.0 required.
  • Academic level programming experience in Python is required.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Leadership experience through work or involvement in community service, athletics, clubs, or other activities preferred
  • Ability to present ideas and information to team, leaders, and peers.

Our policy is to provide employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other conditions or opportunities of employment, without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, ancestry, mental and physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, age, and pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by law. Over 1200 service providers, operators, and enterprises in over 120 countries have leveraged DZS innovation, open solutions, and agility to arm them with the network resources and deployment freedom they need to lead in their markets and deliver an unrivaled communications experience. With manufacturing, engineering, service and support centers of excellence spread across the globe, DZS is positioned to bring next-generation technologies and world-class solutions to service providers and enterprises who are poised to transform, compete and win.

Apply your academic knowledge of hardware or software engineering to real-world R&D team assignments with our DZS R&D team. Our growth-oriented company provides you with valuable learning opportunities assisting with various stages of the product development lifecycle. This is not a typical “busy work” type of internship.   • Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics major

At DZS, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Position Summary

Are you a talented, motivated graduate student with a strong interest in information retrieval, natural language processing, and machine learning? Join our AI Engineering team for a 10 week (minimum) paid internship working on areas such as sentiment analysis, text classification, search, clustering, and statistical estimation. Join an innovative and fast-paced team building software that allows legal professionals to use AI to filter millions of documents and surface the insights most important to their case or investigation.

We are thoughtful about design and focused on ensuring that our clients have software that is both useful and useable. You won’t be buried in a dark corner – you’ll have the opportunity to actively shape the software, while working as an integral part of a dynamic team of AI engineers and data scientists who are focused on writing great code, learning every day, and having a lot of fun.

If you think you’d be the right fit for our team, we’d love to hear from you.

You will:
  • Apply natural language processing. machine learning technology, and statistical estimation to legal text analytics problems
  • Push the frontiers of effectiveness, interpretability, legal defensibility, and fairness in text analytics
We'd love to hear from you if:
  • You are currently enrolled in a Master's or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or in a related discipline
  • You are available to work full-time for a minimum of 10 weeks outside of periods you are taking classes
  • You have experience with text processing and machine learning
  • You have experience writing Java and Python code in a Linux / Unix environment
  • You enjoy working with large textual data sets, probability, and statistics
Bonus Points
  • Knowledge of linguistics (particularly morphology)
  • Reading knowledge of multiple (human!) languages
  • An interest in AI ethics issues

Depending on the project and your interest, summer internship work may lead to scientific publications. Work originating in past internships has been published at information retrieval and AI & Law conferences.

Hiring Policy

This job description reflects the present requirements of the position. As duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to amendment.

About Marvell

At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below.

The Opportunity

Marvell Storage Business Unit, designs and validates leading edge products for Client and Enterprise market. As a member of a validation team, the candidate will be responsible for developing or enhancing test software, and testing/debugging various components of Storage products. The member will also have an opportunity to learn voltage, temperature and power characterization methods of various components, using automated infrastructure.

  • Understanding the requirements of the product

  • Strong Programming Skills in C/C++ and using python scripts, in a Windows type environment
  • Strong problem solving skill, with experience in using debug equipment
  • Understanding of System Architecture of Multi-threaded systems
  • Understanding of Voltage and temperature affect on Silicon

The Perks

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

Your Future

Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

With approximately $2.3 billion in sales and 4,000 employees worldwide, we have a material presence in more than 20 countries.

Position Summary

J.M. Huber Corporation offers a paid internship program in the Atlanta headquarters to provide undergraduate students with opportunities to discover the manufacturing industry, gain real-world and cross-functional experience, and develop professional skills and networks. As a part of this journey we are building out several Data Analytics Platforms that will further enable self-service reporting for functional analysts. This is a unique opportunity for a student to collaborate with multiple functional analysts assisting them in requirements gathering, data preparation, and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.

Huber Engineered Materials (HEM) is in the middle of a digital transformation.   • Applicant should have previous exposure to the circuit simulation area and experience in EDA-relevant software development, particular C/C++ unix development.

  • Background in one or more of numerical techniques for VLSI circuit simulation or related general numerical simulation algorithms (numerical linear algebra, computational electromagnetics, parallel numerical algorithms) or semiconductor device modeling is required.

  • Applicant should be a candidate for an advanced degree in the electrical engineering, computer science, or related field.

  • Understanding of analog/RF/custom IC design and verification practices is a strong plus.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

The Role
Gotham Greens is seeking a Technical Product Manager Intern who can help us advance the farm of the future. In this role, you will use data science, proprietary software tools, hardware, and data visualizations to optimize the way we grow produce and to enable strategic decision making. You'll work with senior leadership to define and scope opportunities for business impact and partner with engineering, data science, UI/UX to build and implement effective, well-designed solutions.

This role sits at the nexus of business and technology, so the ideal candidate is fluent in both and can liaise seamlessly across functions and people. We are looking for someone who is energized by thinking strategically to solve big questions and challenges and also loves going deep into the details and data. The ideal candidate is also an extremely effective project manager with experience leading complex initiatives through to completion.

We are also open to hiring summer interns focused in software development, data science, and business analytics.

Qualifications

What we’re looking for:

  • Students pursuing an advanced degree in Business, Analytics, Computer Science or a related degree/experience
  • 2+ years' experience in a highly strategic, analytical and operational role in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with engineers, data scientists, and project stakeholders to determine the function and priority of proposed products
  • Structured thinking and the ability to prioritize competing projects
  • Ability to find creative solutions to difficult problems covering multiple working groups simultaneously
  • Familiarity with user experience design, technology projects, and web technologies
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL & Tableau/data visualization software

The ideal candidate:

  • Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment
  • Passionate commitment to the company vision
  • Appreciation for sustainable agriculture and food

Zola is looking for an innovative MBA Product Manager Intern to join our product team this summer. This is a 10-week internship, where you will rotate between the Vendor Marketplace team and Core Experience team. You'll be teamed up with 2 dedicated engineering interns for the duration of your internship, while partnering closely with a full-time product manager and designer on each respective team. This is an exciting and unique internship structure that will give you the opportunity to work cross-functionally to solve real business problems in two of Zola's key focus areas.

We're looking for someone who can both sweat the details and tie them back to the big picture. The successful candidate should be equally comfortable talking tech with developers and brand positioning with marketing. We are looking for someone with a strong product mind who is excited to roll their sleeves up and dive into user problems as well as handle the nitty gritty of developing a new feature in a very short amount of time.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Drive end-to-end feature development, from cross-functional ideation and solutioning to execution
  • Develop hypotheses and conduct user research to validate ideas and influence feature direction
  • Define and communicate project requirements to working team and stakeholders
  • Analyze business impact and present findings to business and product teams
  • Deeply understand the customer journey across Zola's products and devices and think creatively about how to serve the customer better
  • Evaluate competitors and the market for capability-oriented and emerging development/technology trends specific to your projects
  • Develop understanding of technical constraints and knowing where to push the boundaries

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Currently pursuing a full-time MBA degree
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage competing tasks in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment
  • Exceptional technical, business and customer experience judgment
  • Creative, scrappy, and customer-obsessed
  • Collaborative team player with ability to build business relationships across functional teams
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; presents effectively to audiences of all types (technical and non-technical)
  • Excellent quantitative skills. Understanding of SQL, Google Analytics and Segment a major plus!
  • Previous experience in a product or analytical role within a high-growth, consumer-focused startup is a plus
  • BA/BS required. A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business is preferred

ABOUT ZOLA

We're Zola, the wedding company that will do anything for love. We're reinventing the wedding planning and registry experience to make the happiest moment in our couples' lives even happier. From engagement to wedding and decorating your first home, Zola is there, combining compassionate customer service with modern tools and technology… all in the service of love.
We built our entire platform from the ground-up in 2013, and quickly became the fastest-growing wedding company in the country. Our team has deep experience creating award-winning online and mobile products that are helpful, intuitive, and simply magical. We're proud to have investor partners including Female Founders Fund, Comcast Ventures, Goldman Sachs, Canvas Ventures, Thrive Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners, among others.

We are passionate about supporting all forms of love, and we're proud of our thriving community of over 1 million couples. We strive to hire a team that is as beautifully diverse as the couples getting married today, and we encourage individuals from every race, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, marital status, religion and perspective to apply. Zola will always be a place where every employee, couple, wedding guest, wedding vendor, and partner will be respected and accepted and valued.

Our headquarters are in NYC, and we have offices in Charlottesville and Montreal. Come work with us!

The CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We’re building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industry

Job Description

The NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) enriches the environment and protects public health for all New Yorkers by providing 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water, managing wastewater and stormwater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. DEP's water supply system is comprised of 19 reservoirs and 3 controlled lakes throughout the system’s 2,000 square mile watershed that extends 125 miles north and west of the City.

The New York City Department of Environmental Protection’s (DEP) Bureau of Business Information Technology (BIT) is responsible for providing quality business, technical and IT system support to our users. This commitment is realized through collaboration, strong relationships and a unified vision with our partners at DEP in order to provide quality technological solutions to our business needs. Providing these services allows us to ensure that DEP continues its tradition of delivering excellent service to the residents of New York City.

BIT’s Application Development Unit is responsible for highly technical and supervisory activities in the design, implementation enhancement, maintenance, and analysis of software systems and the development of applications programming. The selected candidate will be assisting with the development of web and mobile applications. The selected candidate should also have a working knowledge of one or more of the following: .NET, HTML, and C#. Additional responsibilities will include assisting with documentation for existing applications, reviewing application code, and creating reports

Job Description:

Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:

Perform Airborne Parts Management tasks supporting programs in the sustainment, proposal and production phases. Interfacing with Design Engineers, Product Development Engineers, Component Engineers, Program Management, Engineering and project leads, external electronic component manufacturers and other related disciplines. The majority of this position will be to create/maintain components in the CIMS (Component Information Management System) including electronic and electro-mechanical components based on vendor datasheets as well as industry and company standards. Sustain repair operations with obsolescence management and substitute parts.

The CE team supports programs by reviewing and approving the selection of electronic components, qualifying electronic components for the applications in which they will be used supporting the manufacture of components both in-house and at suppliers, conducting failure analysis and RCCA (root cause and corrective Action) as part of anomaly investigations, creating and revising specifications for components, and supporting subcontractor and suppliers to ensure electronic components are qualified for usage per the contract and the Parts, Materials and Processes (PMP) Plan.

Position Description

ElectriCom, a Utility Construction company founded in 1960, has experienced continuous growth since its inception. The company takes pride in focusing on family values both in the workplace and with its customer base. ElectriCom seeks employees with the ability and desire to work for a progressive company. ElectriCom offers a competitive package for both wages and benefits. Employees who show quality performance will have the opportunity for advancement and further development of skills.

This role is based in our home office in Paoli, Indiana. This is a dual-purpose role, focusing both on employee training and development, as well as the employee lifecycle specifically relating to the onboarding and offboarding processes. To be successful in this position you must be self-driven, passionate about helping people, and maintaining exceptional data entry accuracy. In many cases you will work with both multiple levels and functions within the organization. This position will report primarily to Training & Development, but have direct ties to Human Resources.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Content Developer for the LMS platform (Cornerstone).
    • Build content, utilizing primarily a SCORM format (Articulate), that will meet multiple needs within the organization.
    • Shop and select content (as applicable) from 3rd party providers.
    • Assist with deployment of content to our Field and Support groups.
    • Work with the LMS Administrator and Sr. Training Manager to refine and continue to improve/develop the LMS platform.
  • Facilitation of classroom, virtual, and hands-on training.
  • Thorough data collection and exceptional data entry is a MUST for accuracy and compliance.
  • HR records audits to ensure accuracy and compliance.
  • Strong organization is a MUST because there are typically multiple new hires to process at the same time daily.
  • Identify and implement process improvements.
  • Perform other duties as requested by Manager.
  • MUST maintain strict confidentiality.

Position Requirements

  • High School diploma required.
  • Current college student preferred – pursuing a degree in Human Resources, Education, Communications, Computer Science, or related field.
  • Previous Training, HR, and onboarding experience preferred.
  • Previous experience with content development and deployment preferred.
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook) required.
  • Ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy.
  • Ability to communicate in professional manner, both verbal and written, is required.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Willingness to travel, both overnight and day trips, if needed.

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team

What you’ll do:


Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Research Executive
Location: Virtual USA
Expected Start Date: June 2021
Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months


In this role, you’ll:


As an intern, your tasks may include:

  • Market research of ISVs (Independent Software vendors), VAR (Value added resellers) and SI (System Integrators)
  • Online research and analysis as required for the project
  • Technology research
  • Research on various Industry


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or Advertising and Marketing or Law or related fields
  • Ability to absorb new concepts and apply them for the tasks
  • Inclination to work in the Software/IT industry.
  • Moderate to expert knowledge of Microsoft productivity tools such as PowerPoint and Excel
  • Strong work ethic


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

SAP Internship Experience Program

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The intern for the SAP Digital Platforms Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing team will support SAP’s digital mandate to make it easy to do business with SAP online by providing a relevant and engaging digital experience. The position will support the personalization program with analysis and reporting, project management, quality assurance, and communication. This role will work with many teams across the organization to assist in the global and regional execution and day-to-day operations to ensure the program’s success.

Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing is on the cutting edge of B2B marketing and digital approaches to the customer journey. If you like forging new paths and have an entrepreneurial mindset, this internship will be a great opportunity.

Position title: SAP Intern –Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing

Location: Newtown Square, PA – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

Expected start date to end date: May 31, 2021 - November 26, 2021

In this role, you’ll:

  • Provide insightful web analytics to help better gauge the success of our programs, including pulling data, building new reports and dashboards, analyzing results and segment construction.
  • Assist with project managing the personalization programs, including but not limited to tracking tasks, liaising with stakeholders, following up on deliverables, and ensuring deadlines are met.
  • Support the creation of new rule-based and machine learning personalization programs by participating in discussions, performing initial research and planning process steps.
  • Manage and run the account listening program for global sales and marketing, monitoring activities for groups of accounts on SAP.com digital properties.
  • Responsible for testing and monitoring the personalization programs on the SAP web properties by applying quality-assurance methods.
  • Maintaining the Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing team’s content to drive awareness and transparency of the team’s programs and offerings. Update the content on the site, write blog posts, monitor user-generated content, and suggest ways to make the site more of an effective tool in communicating the mission of the team.
  • Build thorough and well-designed PowerPoint presentations to educate audiences on upcoming or past personalization programs.
  • Other special projects and tasks as assigned

Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Skills / Competencies.

Web Analytics and Tech Competencies:

  • Experience with and interest in web reporting and analytics
  • Ability to articulate data stories to business audiences
  • Advanced level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
  • Experience with Adobe Analytics preferred

Quality Assurance:

  • Detail-oriented
  • Commitment to accuracy

Communication and presentation skills:

  • Effective communication skills, both oral and written

Project Management:

  • Ability to work in a high-paced, dynamic environment, juggling multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience with preparing meeting materials, taking comprehensive notes, and managing notifications/correspondence

General

  • Passion for technology and a service-oriented mindset will be a major advantage in this role

Educational Requirements (degrees, class completion, etc.)

This position requires candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or Master’s program which is applicable to the position. Seeking degrees in Information Management, Computer Science, Marketing, or General Business. Commensurate experience in digital marketing positions a plus.

Qualifications:

  • Requires candidates to currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program which is applicable to the position
  • Experience with Adobe Analytics is a plus

The company is one of the fastest growing startups in New York City and recently raised a $470 million Series E investment led by Coatue in March 2021. Other investors in Attentive include Bain Capital Ventures, Sequoia, IVP.

We work with 3,000+ of the most innovative brands like Coach, Urban Outfitters, CB2, Pura Vida, Lulus, and Jack in the Box. Attentive was founded in 2016 by the co-founders of TapCommerce, a mobile marketing platform that was acquired by Twitter in 2014.

TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. Get hands-on training in ground-breaking technology. Work with the Graph Database team to design a database as a solution to pertinent issues in contemporary society that involve highly-connected data. Although relational databases are a fundamental technology in the world of data, we work to answer questions that relational databases simply are not built for. TIBCO Graph DB is a true relational database, which can provide better, faster solutions in the age where data resembles a web of information, rather than a flat table of data. Get involved and gain knowledge in graph database technology!

Job Title: Intern - DevOps Engineer

Primary Location: USA – Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland (Remote Work)

Schedule: Part-time

Pay Rate: $15.00 per hour

Travel: No travel


Job Highlights:

OMNI Technologies is looking for the right candidate to join our development operations (DevOps) team! Interns will gain hands-on experience working directly with DevOps technologies and processes related to the Agile software development lifecycle. The candidate must enjoy a high energy work environment and working in a team atmosphere. As an intern at OMNI Technologies, you will work on some intelecutually engaging projects and be supported by a cross-functional team of highly talented peers. Interns are placed on a team and will be assigned a specific mentor. A typical intership lasts 90 days and upon successful completion can end in an employment offer in a junior-level position. Please note, due to this, we have a strong preference for near/recent college graduates or personnel with some practical experience looking for a career change.


Job Requirements:

In a perfect world, you would check all the boxes, but obviously we don't live in a perfect world (Hello Pandemic Life!). If you have most of the things and are confident you can understand and execute the Work, we're willing to give you a shot.

As a DevOps Engineer, you will work in the field of production operations where the intersection of software development, software deployment, cloud infrastructure, and customers meet. You will work on one or more of the following projects, web based development to support self-service portal, employ data science techniques to gain insight on production systems (performance and usage,) and/or using cloud based APIs to automate infrastructure changes.

  • Attention to detail
  • Minimum of two years of undergraduate coursework in a technical degree; Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar degree
  • Familiar with Software Development languages
    • JavaScript (Node.js or Vue.js preffered)
    • Python
    • PHP
  • Familiarity with various open source technologies
  • Familiarity with container based solutions (Kubernetes, Docker)
  • Ability to build web-based tools, microservices and solutions
  • Understand how IT operations are managed
  • Manage source control using Git, GitLab
  • Knowledge of Linux based infrastructures
  • Must work well with others and be a team player
  • Must be able to work in an Agile software development environment
  • Write scripts and automation using Perl/Python/Groovy/Java/Bash
  • Configure and manage data sources like MySQL, Mongo, Elasticsearch, Cassandra
  • Able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
  • Must be a U.S. Citizen
  • Must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment drug screen and a comprehensive background check

Preferred Skills:

  • Previous experience with software development or infrastructure development and operations
  • Experience with Linux infrastructures, database SQL (MySQL), CI/CD tools, scripting such as JavaScript, PHP, Python, Perl, Ruby, .NET, Scrum/Kanban/SAFe, Agile workflow methodologies
  • Knowledge/Experience developing web-based applications using containers, microservices and APIs
  • Knowledge/Experience in using Git
  • Previous Internship experience

Key Job Functions:

  • Design and implement build, deployment, and configuration management
  • Test implemented designs
  • Build and test automation tools for infrastructure provisioning
  • Handle code deployments in all environments
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve
  • Maintain day-to-day management and administration of projects
  • Manage CI and CD tools with team
  • Document and design various processes; update existing processes
  • Brainstorm for new ideas and ways to improve development delivery
  • Consult with peers for feedback during testing stages

Since this position revolves around DevOps, we'd additionally like to see examples of YOUR existing work (screenshots, URLs, and/or code samples, including description and context for each). With OMNI, you will have the opportunity to build your skill set, gain professional experience, work with real clients and have some fun in the process. All of this looks good on your resume!


OMNI Technologies
